alert.note: Alert for Northern Panhandle (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued June 14 at 1:22AM MDT until June 14 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow Above 4000 feet. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 10 inches with the highest amounts above 5000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern Panhandle Mountains. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hikers and campers be prepared for impacts from snow and breezy conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are expected to lower from 5500 feet to 4000 feet Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Wear proper attire and be prepared for wintery conditions in the morning.
